div.style: border-bottom:1px dotted black; padding:10px 0px; padding-right:30px; padding-left:5px;
border-bottom:1px dotted black; padding:10px 0px; padding-right:30px; padding-left:5px;
border-bottom:1px dotted black; padding:10px 0px; padding-right:30px; padding-left:5px;

p.b: I pray that everyone is well and keeping safe during this time of closures, fluctuating societal expectations, and varying restrictions. One thing that we want our families to be assured of at this time, is that DLH Academy staff is still here for you and working to provide a measure of support that will enable our children to continue to engage in academic enrichment activities while at home. Though our school is officially closed as is the mandate, we encourage all students to utilize the online resourses provided on our DLH Academy website. DLH Academy staff will continue to actualize our IB standards of caring and seeking to help make our world a better place by our actions during this time. As life-long learners and caring citizens, we not only expect our students to maintain a work ethic and essential character traits such as integrity, empathy, responsibility, independence, etc., we continue to work to exemplify these expectations as well. As such, we have provided a number of learning activities that are available to families on the school web site. Please note that although our home page has a myriad of learning activities, there are designated sites in which our teachers will monitor and provide feedback and suggestions for improvement in order to help everyone to get the very most out of their online learning experiences. The sites monitored by teachers will be listed on their individual teacher pages, which will be accessible from the main page, by Monday March 30th. Teachers will also respond to inquiries submitted to their emails, Dojo accounts, etc., to answer questions regarding the suggested sites or any feedback previously provided. As teachers are working to review and keep sites updated, respond to inquiries as efficiently and effectively as possible, as well as work with their own families (who are also home from school) students/parents may expect a response to questions within 48 hours.

Additional support provided includes updates on local resources available for families, such as food pick up sites, helpful announcements such as the free 60-day internet service offered by Spectrum; links on healthy living and continued character development, etc. Parents will also find re-enrollment forms that can be accessed on our site that can be completed and submitted through email attachment. Finally, DLH Academy will continue to send out our weekly newsletter, in order to keep families updated with the most current school and state expectations and follow-ups. The newsletter will also include tips for fun and safe at home family activities for your youngest and most active learners.

Though none of our activities are mandatory at this time, we are excited to be able to offer this support for our learning community in order to keep our children sharp and progressing academically as much as possible. Faithful student participation in academic activities and the use of structured daily routines will significantly help students. We want to continue building essential work habits, academic stamina, perseverance, responsibility, and a higher level of independence. These are all traits that students must apply in order benefit from the resources and support available. This is the type of response expected of our IB scholars! Please encourage your children to commit to daily activities that will help them nurture and develop those skills and values that enable them to be their best, thereby engaging in excellent self-management and improving and encouraging those around them! Be well and stay safe!!
